docs.title: Globi Workshop Setup Guide
docs.text:
This guide will walk you through setting up the Globi environment. Please follow each step carefully based on your operating system.

Before starting, ensure you have the following installed on your system:

docs.title: 1. Install Docker
docs.text: Docker is required to run the Hatchet server locally.

docs.title: macOS
docs.text:
1. Download Docker Desktop for Mac
  2. Open the downloaded .dmg file and drag Docker to your Applications folder

  3. Launch Docker Desktop from Applications

  4. Verify installation by running in Terminal: 

    docker --version

FOR MAC:

docker not found
  1. Make sure that docker is set properly in path. For Mac, this is :
export PATH=$PATH:$HOME/.docker/bin

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
1. Download Docker Desktop for Windows
  2. Run the installer and follow the installation wizard
  3. Restart your computer if prompted
  4. Launch Docker Desktop
  5. Verify installation by running in PowerShell or Command Prompt: 
    docker --version

docs.title: Linux (Ubuntu/Debian)
docs.text:
1. Update your package index: 
    sudo apt-get update
  2. Install Docker: 
    sudo apt-get install docker.io
  3. Start Docker and enable it to start on boot: 
    sudo systemctl start docker
sudo systemctl enable docker
  4. Add your user to the docker group (to run docker without sudo): 
    sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
  5. Log out and log back in for the group change to take effect
  6. Verify installation: 
    docker --version

docs.title: 3. Install Python and uv
docs.text: This project requires Python 3.12 or higher and uses uv for package management.

docs.title: TODO: only install uv, use uv instructions to install python
macOS/Linux
docs.text:
1. Install uv:
curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
  1. Verify installation: 
    uv --version
  2. After installing uv, you can install python if you don't have it already. To check if you do, verify through:
python --version

docs.title: Review the uv documentation on how to install python:
docs.text:
https://docs.astral.sh/uv/guides/install-python/

Check that you have the right version installed:

python --version

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
1. Download and install Python 3.12+ from python.org
  2. During installation, make sure to check "Add Python to PATH"
  3. Install uv using pip: 
    pip install uv
  4. Verify installation: 
    uv --version

docs.title: Install git
docs.text:
Check if you have git installed on your computer already:

git --version

If not, then go to the git website for required steps to download https://git-scm.com/install/

docs.title: Installing make
docs.text:
For Mac, make should be fully installed already. For Windows, you need to install make in order to use any of the following commands. To do this, you use one of the following methods:

choco install make
